page.title: 10THE OLD RAILWAY
page.content: Until 1955 Takeley had a passenger railway which was built in 1869 to connect Bishop's Stortford with Witham.It remained open to goods until 1965 when it was used mainly to transport bananas to the Geest factory at Little Canfield.The rails have now been taken up and the track makes a pleasant bridle path. However this may have to go to make a way for a road scheme as has been done at Great Dunmow.At present it does provide a sanctuary for both people and animals away from the bustle and noise of the main road.Today however this quiet may often be destroyed by the noise and danger of motor cycles.
